modules.description: Prints text diffs with added lines in green and removed lines in red. Operates on `Api_watch.Text_diff.t` values, enhancing the standard diff output with color codes. Useful for command-line tools that display file or configuration changes with visual emphasis on modifications.

This module provides functions to convert low-level diffs into a structured textual format and pretty-print them in a git diff-like style. It works with string lists and maps to represent original and modified text lines. The `from_diff` function transforms diffs into a printable structure, while `pp` outputs the result, with optional color support for added and removed lines.

This module loads compiled interface files and extracts type signatures from them. It operates on file paths and returns results containing type signatures or error messages. Use it to analyze OCaml compiled modules and retrieve their public type information.

This module provides operations for managing string-keyed maps, including modification (addition, removal, functional updates), transformation (filtering, partitioning, merging), and ordered traversal (forward, reverse, or from a specific key). It works directly with string-keyed maps and utilizes sequences for

This module computes differences between OCaml module signatures, tracking changes to values and modules. It works with `Types.value_description` and `Types.module_declaration` to produce structured diffs, such as identifying modified, added, or removed values and modules. Concrete use cases include analyzing API changes between library versions and generating human-readable diff reports for interface evolution.

This module coordinates API change detection and reporting by integrating map operations, signature diffing, and interface loading. It tracks differences in type signatures across OCaml library versions and formats the results for readability. Key use cases include version comparison of compiled modules and generating structured, colorized diff output for API evolution.
